> we use EMMA on the projects I work on. It's not integrated with
> Eclipse, but it works well and is free. I haven't really found great
> need to integrate my coverage tool with my IDE, because of the way I
> use it. I'm usually interested in running a whole bunch of tests and
> then seeing how my coverage looks for the whole suite. Then, I drill
> down, notice I missed some methods or classes or whatever, and then
> go write tests for those.

Correct, and this is how those of us who use EMMA for BVT do it.

>>>>> something more integrated, e.g.

to give faster feedback.
